award_title: Magic-Sized Clusters as Universal Intermediates for Nanomaterials Discovery
subject: Making your nanocrystal work easier to share
body:
Hi Brandi,

I came across your work on magic-sized clusters and nanocrystals at UW. With all the synthesis methods and cluster-to-nanocrystal conversion data you're generating, I imagine you get the occasional "code available upon request" email.

I'm working on Ouro, which helps researchers share computational work (workflows, datasets, notebooks) in a way that's actually reproducible and discoverable by others in your field. Put it up once, point people there forever.

Would you be open to a quick chat?

Best
